description: Borrowed from Latin rīpārius (“relating to a riverbank”)  +‎ -an.

adjectives.description: riparian (comparative more riparian, superlative most riparian)

entries.meaning: Of or relating to the bank of a river or stream.
examples: A kingfisher, an airborne jewel, whirrs past, stickleback in its beak, and disappears into a thicket of riparian willow.

entries.meaning: (chiefly law) A person or other entity that lives or owns property along the shore of a river.
